alert.note: Alert for Anderson; Coffey; Franklin; Lyon; Osage; Shawnee; Wabaunsee (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 09 at 3:49PM CDT until May 09 at 4:45PM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: The National Weather Service in Topeka has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Western Franklin County in east central Kansas... Western Shawnee County in east central Kansas... Western Anderson County in east central Kansas... Southeastern Wabaunsee County in east central Kansas... Osage County in east central Kansas... Coffey County in east central Kansas... Lyon County in east central Kansas... * Until 445 PM CDT. * At 349 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Auburn to 4 miles west of Lebo to 12 miles west of Madison, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Southwestern Topeka, Emporia, Osage City, Burlington, Carbondale, Rossville, Dover, Silver Lake, Auburn, Overbrook, Lyndon, Lebo, Burlingame, Americus, Scranton, Waverly, Olpe, New Strawn, Quenemo and Melvern. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 128 and 170. Interstate 70 between mile markers 343 and 353. Kansas Turnpike between mile markers 117 and 174. HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.

area.areaDesc: Anderson; Coffey; Franklin; Lyon; Osage; Shawnee; Wabaunsee
